subject: Technology
title: MySpace and the Music Revolution
description: Learn MySpace and the Music Revolution in one minute.

hook.text: Before Spotify, unknown bands had almost no way to share their music with the world.

buildup.text: MySpace launched in 2003 and let musicians upload songs directly to their profile pages.

discovery.text: Arctic Monkeys became the first band to hit number one largely through MySpace fans sharing tracks.

twist.text: MySpace let users customize pages with HTML. The result was millions of garish, glittery profiles.

climax.text: At its peak, MySpace was the most visited website in the United States, beating even Google.

punchline.text: MySpace gave everyone a stage. Most just wanted glitter.

quiz.question: What made MySpace unique among early social networks?
options: Musicians could upload songs to their profiles
